instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3588: What is 820-3588? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Got this with "explosion" in  <CAPACITOR>C6300</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C6305</CAPACITOR> area. IT was burnt. Cleaned and replaced all componentes . Short is gone but still not turning on. 

CHecked all S5 rails and they all are ok. Not getting <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> Good and <SIGNAL>PP1V01_S0</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground or near to short ( 50Ohms.). 



Whant else can i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message:
Autoreply. <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> is making board not turning on. When it is removed, board start normally, when i put back new or old <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> it doesnt turn on.


Also checked pin by pin if there is any short but only GND pins are shorted all other are ok. Will try with another new chip ( from donor) and back with answer.


both ic.s are  SSM3302  the only difference is that original is  SSM3302 A#309 and donor is  SSM3302  A#244 , does it matter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Did you check both <SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> rails, when <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> is on the board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: 12V0 with <CHIP>U6300</CHIP> on board is beginning go up very slowly  from 0 V, now after 2 minutes with power supply connected i have 1.8V and growing. <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: I was thinking about diode mode readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Diode mode of 12 and 3.3 V on <CHIP>U6300</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on.
threads.message: Yes, to see if the audio chip pulls-down any.
